intro: Schmaltzia simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple, fleshy, and often covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Schmaltzia simplicifolia produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the summer months.
